         <div class="issue-slider">
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            NACDL Launches Initiative to Educate, Litigate Privacy Challenges in a Digital Age
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/announcement.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            NACDL announced the establishment of the NACDL Fourth Amendment Center, a project made possible by support from the Charles Koch Foundation, FCJ, and the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.nacdl.org/Fourth-Amendment-Center-Launch/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            The Feminine Sixth: Women for the Defense
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/web_feature_box_150x100_Lyon_Andrea_Book.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
           </p>
           <p title="temporary paragraph, click here to add a new paragraph">
            On March 1, NACDL Press released "The Feminine Sixth: Women for the Defense," a groundbreaking book on women in criminal defense by Andrea D. Lyon. Ms. Lyon is a leading criminal defense attorney, legal scholar, Dean and Professor of Law at Valparaiso University School of Law, and decades-long NACDL member. You can purchase The Feminine Sixth at
            <a href="https://www.thefemininesixth.com/" title="www.thefemininesixth.com">
             www.thefemininesixth.com
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.thefemininesixth.com/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            New Report on Judicial Responsibility for Justice
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/Criminal_Defense_Issues/web_image_150x100_Hofstra-Judicial_Report_NEW.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            In April 2017, a groundbreaking  conference was convened that assembled judges, prosecutors, defense attorneys,  scholars, and criminal justice policy experts to identify practical reforms to  improve the quality of justice in state and local criminal justice systems.  This report shares discussions and recommendations that emerged from the  conference’s presentations, panels, and work groups.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="/judicialresponsibilityforjustice/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            NACDL Presidential Summit/ 17th Annual State Criminal Justice Network Conference
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/nacdl_logo_feature.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Shattering the Shackles of Collateral Consequences: Exploring Moral Principles and Economic Innovations to Restore Rights and Opportunity
            </em>
            will examine the destructive effect that a vast network of penalties, debarments, and disabilities that arise from a criminal conviction has on the millions who have contact with the criminal justice system.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="/scjn/conference/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            The Rhode Island Project
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/Rhode Island Report Feature Box image.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
           </p>
           <p title="temporary paragraph, click here to add a new paragraph">
            The Sixth Amendment's promise that every person accused of a crime is entitled to counsel is a hollow one when the attorney appointed lacks the time and resources to provide meaningful representation. In order to determine whether defenders in Rhode Island are facing a caseload crisis, NACDL, the American Bar Association Standing Committee on Legal Aid and Indigent Defendants (ABA SCLAID), and the accounting firm of BlumShapiro undertook an assessment of the Rhode Island Public Defender system.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.nacdl.org/publicdefense">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            Texas Affiliate Sets Up Harvey Lawyers Assistance Fund
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/announcement.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            The Texas Criminal Defense Lawyers Association (TCDLA), and its educational unit TCDLEI, has created a relief fund to help fellow criminal defense lawyers affected by Harvey. Donations will be used to help attorneys continue their practice and to defray costs of continuing legal education and replacing legal publications and educational materials. Click "Read More" to be directed to TCDLA’s donation page.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="http://www.tcdla.com/harvey">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            Restoration of Rights Project – Updated Online Resource
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/collat_cons_feature white.png"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            The Collateral Consequences Resource Center and its  partner organizations, the National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers,  the National Legal Aid and Defender Association, and the National HIRE Network,  are pleased to announce the launch of the newly expanded and fully updated  Restoration of Rights Project.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="http://restoration.ccresourcecenter.org/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            Challenging Government Hacking in Criminal Cases
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/Criminal_Defense_Issues/web_Gov_Hacking_cvr_feature_150x100__3302017.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            The  ACLU, with contributions by NACDL and EFF, published a guide for defense  attorneys to challenge evidence seized by government-installed computer  malware. The report assesses recent court decisions evaluating the government’s  use of the controversial hacking technique and makes recommendations for the  most promising avenues to have evidence suppressed.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.nacdl.org/Malware-Guide-Release/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            Policing Body Cameras: Policies and Procedures to Safeguard the Rights of the Accused
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/Criminal_Defense_Issues/web_Body_Cams_rep_cvr_feature_150x100__2222017.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            In response  to a series of high-profile police killings of unarmed people of color, law  enforcement agencies across the country began adopting body cameras as a  solution to requests for more transparency and accountability. Based on the  findings of NACDL’s Body Camera Task Force, this report offers the perspective  of the criminal defense bar and provides recommendations to protect the rights  of the accused in body camera jurisdictions.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.nacdl.org/Police-Body-Cameras-Release/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            Support the Foundation for Criminal Justice™
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/FCJ_build287_logo_TM.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            Support the most important work taking place in criminal justice reform with a gift to the Foundation for Criminal Justice (FCJ). This is an important time for supporters of criminal justice reform. The nation's criminal defense bar is launching watershed projects that will set the agenda for years on issues including Brady disclosure, access to effective counsel, collateral consequences of conviction, and protecting the Fourth Amendment in the digital era. The FCJ is supporting vitally important projects that will make lasting improvements to the criminal justice system.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="http://www.nacdl.org/foundation/give/2014/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            NACDL Offers Scholarship Funding to Public Defense Providers
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/announcement.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            NACDL is pleased to offer scholarship assistance  for public defense providers to attend Continuing Legal Education programs. The  scholarships are awarded in the form of full or partial reimbursement of the  registration costs of the excellent training programs offered by NACDL and  other national organizations. Limited travel reimbursement stipends may also be  awarded to qualifying individuals to help defray the costs of travel and  lodging.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.nacdl.org/publicdefense">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            New Affinity Partner - Answeringlegal.com
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/web_Answering_Legal_feature_150x100__10252016.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            NACDL members receive
            <strong>
             10% off
            </strong>
            the #1 answering service  for attorneys. Use promo code: "NACDL".
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="http://www.answeringlegal.com">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="issue">
           <h5>
            New Affinity Partner - Page Vault
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="Img" src="/uploadedImages/images/features/web_pagevault_straight_feature_150x100__06282016.jpg"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            Page Vault enables lawyers to easily and securely capture web content – everything from standard  web pages to blogs and social media pages – for subsequent use as evidence in  US courts. NACDL members receive  10-15% off subscription services.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a class="more" href="https://www.page-vault.com/national-association-criminal-defense-lawyers/">
             Read More
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
